channel.title: Loading models to my java project
channel.description: Hi there. i want to add some models to a java project but is it possible? i mean how can i load it and its should be .obj/.dat, i know it possible because runescape load it somehow anyways thanks for any help.

item.title: Loading models to my java project
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I dont want to my server only to my java game.

Read full topic
item.source: Loading models to my java project

item.title: Loading models to my java project
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Should re-name this thread to “please help me add customs to my server! :’(”

There are open source engines such as http://jmonkeyengine.com/engine/ and others for Java. It covers shaders, lighting etc
Using Permutation method in loading the data (hoping it’s for an actual development and not an rsps) can be useful.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading models to my java project
item.dc:creator: @S_v2 .S. v2
item.description:
@S_v2 wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Wavefront .obj file

OBJ (or .OBJ) is a geometry definition file format first developed by Wavefront Technologies for its Advanced Visualizer animation package. The file format is open and has been adopted by other 3D graphics application vendors. The OBJ file format is a simple data-format that represents 3D geometry alone — namely, the position of each vertex, the UV position of each texture coordinate vertex, vertex normals, and the faces that make each polygon defined as a list of vertices, and texture vertices. ...


en.wikipedia.org

3D projection

3D projection is any method of mapping three-dimensional points to a two-dimensional plane. As most current methods for displaying graphical data are based on planar (pixel information from several bitplanes) two-dimensional media, the use of this type of projection is widespread, especially in computer graphics, engineering and drafting. When the human eye looks at a scene, objects in the distance appear smaller than objects close by. Orthographic projection ignores this effect to allow the cr...

hth

Read full topic

item.source: Loading models to my java project

item.title: Loading models to my java project
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

RuneScape uses a proprietary format for their models. Your best bet is to use a format that is wider known and well documented. There is also much more than just loading the model, you need a way to render them, light them, animate them, etc.

Read full topic
